title: Small businesses oppose Bank of England economist's call to extend gender pay reporting
text:
The Bank of England’s chief economist has called for gender pay reporting to be widened to companies with just 30 employees but the proposal faced opposition from small businesses last night.

Andy Haldane, a member of the Bank’s Monetary Policy Committee, said there is a “strong case” for extending compulsory reporting of gender pay gaps beyond just companies with more than 250 employees, a policy that covers 40pc of private sector workers.

The Federation of Small Businesses warned its members “would be faced with a number of practical barriers, not least where confidentiality is concerned”.
